de.feig.FEDM.Core

Class ICommandGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.feig.FEDM.Core.ICommandGroup

  • public class ICommandGroup
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal class providing Reader command specific methods.
    Description:
    This class realizes the nested interface with general command methods for the Reader class ReaderModule.
    Methods of this class can be called with the ICmd member of ReaderModule.

    • Method Detail

      • getCommandParaAsBoolean

        public boolean getCommandParaAsBoolean(java.lang.String paraID)
        Method for getting a command parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraID - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the interface ReaderCommand and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        Returns:
        boolean value
        Description:
        Method returns a command parameter value, identified by parameter name. As the parameter value is of type boolean, only single bit parameters can be returned.
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • getCommandParaAsByte

        public byte getCommandParaAsByte(java.lang.String paraID)
        Method for getting a command parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraID - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the interface ReaderCommand and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        Returns:
        byte value
        Description:
        Method returns a command parameter value, identified by parameter name. As the parameter value is of type byte, only single byte parameters can be returned.
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • getCommandParaAsByteArray

        public byte[] getCommandParaAsByteArray(java.lang.String paraID)
        Method for getting a command parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraID - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the interface ReaderCommand and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        Returns:
        byte value
        Description:
        Method returns a command parameter value, identified by parameter name. The parameter value is a byte array and can return a multi-byte parameter.
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • getCommandParaAsInteger

        public int getCommandParaAsInteger(java.lang.String paraID)
        Method for getting a command parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraID - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the interface ReaderCommand and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        Returns:
        integer value
        Description:
        Method returns a command parameter value, identified by parameter name. As the parameter value is of type int, only parameters with up to 4 bytes can be returned.
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • getCommandParaAsLong

        public long getCommandParaAsLong(java.lang.String paraID)
        Method for getting a command parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraID - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the interface ReaderCommand and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        Returns:
        long value
        Description:
        Method returns a command parameter value, identified by parameter name. As the parameter value is of type long, only parameters with up to 8 bytes can be returned.
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • getCommandParaAsString

        public java.lang.String getCommandParaAsString(java.lang.String paraID)
        Method for getting a command parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraID - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the interface ReaderCommand and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        Returns:
        String value
        Description:
        Method returns a command parameter value, identified by parameter name. The parameter value is a hex-coded string and can return a multi-byte parameter. Hex-coded string means, that a hex value of 0xAB39F1 will be returned as "AB39F1".
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • setCommandPara

        public int setCommandPara(java.lang.String paraID,
                          boolean data)
        Method for setting a command parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraID - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the interface ReaderCommand and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        data - command parameter value
        Returns:
        status
        • 1 if OK and parameter is modified (new value overwrites previous value)
        • 0 if OK, but parameter is not modified (new value is equal to previous value)
        • < 0 error code

        Description:
        Overload method sets a command parameter value, identified by parameter name. This prepares the next command to be executed to with sendProtocol(byte).
        As the parameter value is of type boolean, only single bit parameters can be set. This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • setCommandPara

        public int setCommandPara(java.lang.String paraID,
                          byte data)

        Parameters:
        paraID - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the interface ReaderCommand and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        data - command parameter value
        Returns:
        status
        • 1 if OK and parameter is modified (new value overwrites previous value)
        • 0 if OK, but parameter is not modified (new value is equal to previous value)
        • < 0 error code

        Description:
        Overload method sets a command parameter value, identified by parameter name. This prepares the next command to be executed to with sendProtocol(byte).
        As the parameter value is of type byte, only single byte parameters can be set.
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

        public int setCommandPara(java.lang.String paraID,
                          long data)
        Method for setting a command parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraID - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the interface ReaderCommand and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        data - command parameter value
        Returns:
        status
        • 1 if OK and parameter is modified (new value overwrites previous value)
        • 0 if OK, but parameter is not modified (new value is equal to previous value)

      • setCommandPara

        public int setCommandPara(java.lang.String paraID,
                          java.lang.String data)
        Method for setting a command parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraID - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the interface ReaderCommand and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        data - command parameter value
        Returns:
        status
        • 1 if OK and parameter is modified (new value overwrites previous value)
        • 0 if OK, but parameter is not modified (new value is equal to previous value)
        • < 0 error code

        Description:
        Overload method sets a command parameter value, identified by parameter name. This prepares the next command to be executed to with sendProtocol(byte).
        The parameter value is a hex-coded string and can set a multi-byte parameter. Hex-coded string means, that a hex value of 0xAB39F1 must be set as "AB39F1".
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • sendProtocol

        public int sendProtocol(byte cmdByte)
                 throws FeException
        The central communication method.
        Parameters:
        cmdByte - control byte
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Protocol traffic is executed with the method sendProtocol. This method gets only the control byte of the desired protocol. All the data necessary for the protocol transfer are taken from the data containers resp. tables. You must therefore ensure that all the protocol data have first been updated.
        This communication method can be used with all port drivers. If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set.

      • sendProtocol

        public java.lang.String sendProtocol(byte cmdByte,
                                     java.lang.String requestData)
                              throws FeException
        An alternative communication method.
        Parameters:
        cmdByte - control byte
        requestData - request data string
        Returns:
        the response data
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        This alternative communication method is for special cases, if the request data must be built without the internal data containers.
        This communication method can be used with all port drivers. If an error occurs, the error code can be queried with the getErrorCode method of the exception class.
        If the reader signals a status, the response data string can be null. In this case, the status byte should be queried with getLastStatus.
